oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Brown County Bluegrass Festival - Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys - 1968-11-10 - part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part one of various performances at the Brown County Jamboree Bluegrass Festival, located in Bean Blossom, Indiana, featuring Bill Monroe (performer) and his Bluegrass Boys, Roland White (guitar), Vic Jordan (banjo), Kenny Baker (fiddle), Jim Monroe (bass), as well as Gordon Terry (performer), Doug Green (performer), Ralph Stanley (performer), and an unidentified performer referred to as Mrs. Walton. Recorded on November 10, 1968.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Monroe; Bluegrass Boys; Doug Green; Gordon Terry; Ralph Stanley
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) [Unidentified] introduces Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys -- (00:43) Opening theme (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (01:09) Bill Monroe thanks the audience and introduces the band -- (02:27) John Henry (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (04:28) Monroe talks and introduces the next tune -- (04:49) There Ain't Nobody Gonna Miss Me When I'm Gone (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (07:08) Monroe introduces the next tune -- (07:20) Walls Of Time (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (10:58) Monroe thanks the audience, and introduces the next tune -- (11:14) Bugle Call Rag (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (12:52) Monroe thanks the audience, and introduces the next tune -- (13:17) Footprints In The Snow (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (16:00) Monroe talks about taking requests, and introduces some other entertainers -- (17:16) Goodbye Old Pal (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (19:27) Monroe introduces the next tune -- (19:34) Mule Skinner Blues (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (21:20) Monroe introduces Jim Monroe -- (21:37) Down In The Willow Garden (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (24:39) Monroe introduces the next tune -- (24:47) I Washed My Hands In Muddy Water (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (27:28) Monroe introduces the next tune -- (27:37) Shenandoah Valley Breakdown (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (29:56) Sunny Side Of The Mountain (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) (incomplete) -- (32:51) Monroe introduces Gordon Terry -- (33:50) Close By (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys, Gordon Terry) -- (36:00) Monroe introduces the next tune -- (36:30) Johnson's Old Grey Mule (Gordon Terry, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (39:50) [audience encore], Terry thanks the audience -- (40:15) Johnson's Old Grey Mule (Gordon Terry, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) (incomplete) -- (41:20) Monroe thanks the audience and introduces the next tune -- (41:50) White Hosue Blues (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (43:18) Train 45 (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (45:13) Monroe introduces the next tune -- (45:37) Blue Moon Of Kentucky (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (47:45) Monroe introduces Mrs. Walton and Doug Green -- (49:00) Rawhide (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (51:47) Monroe thanks the audience and welcomes Mrs. Walton -- (52:25) Foggy River (Mrs. Walton, Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys) -- (54:55) Monroe thanks Mrs. Walton -- (55:55) Monroe talks about being on tour without a guitar player, and Green filled in for him, Monroe welcomes Green -- (57:14) Blue Ridge Mountain Blues (Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys, Doug Green) -- (59:48) Monroe introduces Ralph Stanley and others -- (1:01:55) Sitting On Top Of The World (various)
